headline: SoundHound Stock Gains From Apivia Courtage Agentic AI Deal
summary: SOUN jumps 3.7% as Apivia Courtage expands use of its Amelia 7 AI, boosting productivity and enterprise credibility.

headline: Gen Z credit scores are having a ‘catastrophic drop’—student loans and doomspending may be to blame
summary: Student loan payments, inflation, and social-media-fueled spending are crushing Gen Z’s credit scores—and it could haunt them for decades.

raw.headline: Gen Z credit scores are having a ‘catastrophic drop’—student loans and doomspending may be to blame

headline: 3 top stock picks: How to play 'Liberation Day losers'
summary: Portfolio Wealth Advisors president and chief investment officer Lee Munson sits down with Julie Hyman to share three "Liberation Day losers" — stocks that tumbled since April, coinciding with President Trump's new tariff policies at the time — that the strategist sees as opportunities for value plays. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Installment Loans For Bad Credit: RadCred Launches Innovative AI Loan System for Bad Credit Emergency Loans Guaranteed Approval USA
summary: RadCred introduces an AI-powered installment loan platform that provides guaranteed approval emergency loans for bad credit across the USA.Glendale, CA, Oct. 09, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- RadCred has rolled out an AI loan system explicitly built for installment loans for bad credit, giving Americans a faster path to emergency funding without the runaround. headline: Equifax Fires Back at FICO in Credit Score Wars
summary: VantageScore 4.0 credit scores will be available for $4.95 per report, with no added fees, through 2027, Equifax announced on Tuesday.

raw.headline: Equifax Fires Back at FICO in Credit Score Wars
raw.summary: VantageScore 4.0 credit scores will be available for $4.95 per report, with no added fees, through 2027, Equifax announced on Tuesday.

headline: Fair Isaac (FICO) Is Up 12.1% After Launching Direct Mortgage Score Access Program – What's Changed
summary: In October 2025, Fair Isaac (FICO) launched the FICO® Mortgage Direct License Program, enabling mortgage industry participants to access FICO scores directly from tri-merge resellers instead of through the three major credit bureaus, accompanied by new fee structures and options for enhanced price transparency. This shift represents a foundational change in credit scoring distribution, intensifying competition among analytics providers and potentially reshaping the cost dynamics for mortgage...
